remarks: If ` B ` is a limit point of the domain of the function ` F ` , then there is at most one limit value of ` F ` at ` B ` .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Dec-2016.)
statement:
limcflf.f $e |- ( ph -> F : A --> CC ) $.
limcflf.a $e |- ( ph -> A C_ CC ) $.
limcflf.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. ( ( limPt ` K ) ` A ) ) $.
limcflf.k $e |- K = ( TopOpen ` CCfld ) $.
limcmo $p |- ( ph -> E* x x e. ( F limCC B ) ) $.
$d A x $.
$d B x $.
$d F x $.
$d K x $.
$d ph x $.
